ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student.

I would summarize this class as the advanced use of primate and other animal models to human evolution (exactly as the course title suggests). I would recommend this course to another student provided they have a strong background in either primatology or human evolution.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I feel that this course exposed me to a wide variety of topics in primatology and human evo in general that definitely deepened my understanding of some issues. There might be ways in which some of the literature we read could be beneficial to the larger themes of my dissertation.

This course augmented how I thought about studying animals. I found great utility in identifying ways that certain species can be used as models or analogies for the evolution of traits in other animals or humans. I gained skills in critically analyzing the literature which claims to do this, and learned a great deal about human evolution in general.
